headline: Deckers, Ross Stores, Intuit: After-hours movers
summary: Deckers Outdoors (DECK) stock is tumbling in extended hours after not providing its full-year guidance. Discount retailer Ross Stores (ROST) is also falling after its second quarter outlook disappointed investors despite topping earnings estimates. Intuit (INTU) gets a boost as it lifts its full-year guidance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Ross Stores Withdraws Outlook Due to Tariffs, Posts Lower Profit
summary: The discount department store chain said it was off to a slow start in the first quarter, and withdrew its full-year outlook as tariffs are expected to drag on earnings.

raw.headline: Ross Stores Withdraws Outlook Due to Tariffs, Posts Lower Profit
raw.summary: The discount department store chain said it was off to a slow start in the first quarter, and withdrew its full-year outlook as tariffs are expected to drag on earnings.

headline: Ross Stores withdraws annual forecasts due to tariff pressures
summary: Macroeconomic uncertainty due to U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff policy, along with still-high inflation, has forced many consumer-facing companies, particularly footwear, apparel and home goods, to trim or withdraw annual targets.  Ross Stores said more than half the goods it sells are made in China, and it would consider raising some prices as inflationary pressures persist in the retail industry, executives said on the post-earnings call.  Ross Stores expects second-quarter earnings to be in the range of $1.40 to $1.55 per share, which includes a cost impact of $0.11 to $0.16 per share from announced tariffs.

Ross Stores expects second-quarter earnings to be in the range of $1.40 to $1.55 per share, which includes a cost impact of $0.11 to $0.16 per share from announced tariffs.

headline: Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) Exceeds Q1 Expectations But Stock Drops
summary: Off-price retail company Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) reported Q1 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 2.6% year on year to $4.98 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $5.37 billion was less impressive, coming in 2.3% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.47 per share was 2.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Ross Stores Reports First Quarter Earnings
summary: DUBLIN, Calif., May 22, 2025--Ross Stores, Inc. (Nasdaq: ROST) today reported earnings per share for the 13 weeks ended May 3, 2025 of $1.47, compared to $1.46 in earnings per share for the 13 weeks ended May 4, 2024. Net income for the period was $479 million versus $488 million last year. Sales for the first quarter of 2025 were $5.0 billion with comparable store sales flat versus last year.

raw.headline: Ross Stores Reports First Quarter Earnings
raw.summary: DUBLIN, Calif., May 22, 2025--Ross Stores, Inc. (Nasdaq: ROST) today reported earnings per share for the 13 weeks ended May 3, 2025 of $1.47, compared to $1.46 in earnings per share for the 13 weeks ended May 4, 2024. Net income for the period was $479 million versus $488 million last year. Sales for the first quarter of 2025 were $5.0 billion with comparable store sales flat versus last year.

headline: Ross Stores (NasdaqGS:ROST) Declares US$0.41 Dividend for June 2025
summary: Ross Stores (NasdaqGS:ROST) recently declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.405 per share, adding stability despite the wider market's 1% decline. During the past month, Ross Stores experienced a price move of 13%, a stark contrast to the broader market's performance. The company's upcoming earnings release may have influenced investor optimism, as anticipation typically affects share price. Broader market trends, including a rebound from a sell-off and fluctuating bond yields, provided a...
